revised_title: Observations of the Satellites of the Georgian Planet and Telescopic Apparatus
tldr: The author, William Herschel, conducted observations of the satellites of the Georgian planet using telescopes with varying magnifying powers. He discovered that the effective power of a telescope is a combination of magnifying and space-penetrating powers. The author also discussed the design and use of telescopes, including the advantages and inconveniences of different eye pieces and the importance of adequate light for observing distant objects.
